comments.author: fernandopsilveira@yahoo.com.br
comments.text:
Created attachment 568034
screenshot.png

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:10.0a1) Gecko/20111018 Firefox/10.0a1
Build ID: 20111018031016

Steps to reproduce:

opened Firefox with only one tab


Actual results:

tab bar behaves like there are multiple tabs open, displaying the New tab button on the right edge of screen, next to the open tabs selection arrow


Expected results:

New tab button should be next to the opened tab
comments.creator: fernandopsilveira@yahoo.com.br

comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:10.0a1) Gecko/20111020 Firefox/10.0a1

It appears in the right place for me. Do you still se this issue with today's nightly? Do you use any tab related add-ons?  Please try starting in safe mode or with a clean profile
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#Make_a_new_profile

comments.creator: virgil.dicu@softvision.ro
comments.raw_text:
I think I now what you mean now. You probably customized your toolbar.(View Toolbar-Customize) Adding an icon before the NewTab Button places it on the right side edge.
I think this is invalid if I'm correct.
comments.text:
I think I now what you mean now. You probably customized your toolbar.(View Toolbar-Customize) Adding an icon before the NewTab Button places it on the right side edge.
I think this is invalid if I'm correct.

comments.author: fernandopsilveira@yahoo.com.br
comments.text: Actually, I did customized my buttons, but add tab button is right after address field.
comments.creator: fernandopsilveira@yahoo.com.br
comments.raw_text: Actually, I did customized my buttons, but add tab button is right after address field.

Yes, that's because you used a separator. If you add a separator to the left of the new tab button, the button will be positioned in the right side. You can play with these options with a new profile:
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#Make_a_new_profile
comments.text:
Yes, that's because you used a separator. If you add a separator to the left of the new tab button, the button will be positioned in the right side. You can play with these options with a new profile:
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#Make_a_new_profile

comments.text:
I'm also having difficulties trying to reproduce this issue; it happens randomly, though I still think it's something related to toolbar customization.

Again, add tab button is positioned exactly beside location bar. I guess this it's related because sometimes other errors occur when I customize toolbars. One example is that stop/reload button sometimes is shown *outside* the location bar...

My enabled add-ons list:

Add-on Compatibility Reporter 0.9.2
Controle de Scripts 1.0.3
Dicionário para Ortografia pt-BR 1.0.0.2
DOM Inspector 2.0.10
Firebug 1.8.3
Flashblock 1.5.15.1
FlashGot 1.3.3
Rainbow 1.4
Test Pilot 1.2
Ubuntu Firefox Modifications 1.0
United States English Spellchecker 5.0.1
Web Developer 1.1.9
